materials.raw_text: Barium (Ba) - 112.4 g, Cobalt (Co) - 95.9 g, Lanthanum (La) - 13.9 g, Thulium (Tm) - 168.9 g

sourcing.instructions: Barium: Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers. Cobalt: Metal suppliers or online marketplaces. Lanthanum: Rare earth suppliers. Thulium: Specialty metallurgical suppliers.
steps: Barium: Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers. Cobalt: Metal suppliers or online marketplaces. Lanthanum: Rare earth suppliers. Thulium: Specialty metallurgical suppliers.

1. Weigh each ingredient using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine Barium, Cobalt, Lanthanum, and Thulium in the specified amounts. 3. Ensure thorough mixing using a spatula or mechanical mixer until a homogeneous mixture is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine Barium, Cobalt, Lanthanum, and Thulium in the specified amounts. 3. Ensure thorough mixing using a spatula or mechanical mixer until a homogeneous mixture is achieved.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the mixture to 1200째C for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the mixture to 1200째C for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and alloying of the materials.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down gradually to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. This process should take around 4-6 hours to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down gradually to room temperature (approximately 25째C). 2. This process should take around 4-6 hours to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinder or sanding tool to smooth the edges and surfaces of the solid sample. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface finish and stability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a grinder or sanding tool to smooth the edges and surfaces of the solid sample. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface finish and stability.
